Robert Huffman wrote:

> The behavior of ComparisonFailure.getMessage() is to replace
> equivalient parts of the actual and expected strings with "...". In my
> opinion, this is truly dreadful behavior. 
<snip />
 > Yet there seems to be no way
> to modify this behavior without changing the source code. And this is
> because of what is, IMHO and with all due respect to Beck and Gamma,
> bad design: all the Assert.assert* methods are static.

That's actually not so big a problem. Build your own TestCase class that 
does not extend Assert, and voila, you can change the way assertEquals() 
behaves for strings. Annoying, but it can be done without changing the 
internal behavior of the TestRunner.

> While a discussion of the design decisions in junit would probably be
> enlightening, that's not my goal; here. I would just like suggestions
> of how to get the strings, in their entirities, into the output.
> 
> Perhaps the answer is to write my own subclass of TestRunner, but then
> I would have to figure out how to integrate the new TestRunner into
> JBuilder.
> 
> Any help would be appreciated.

Google "assertEquals patch". I'm sure you'll find something useful. A 
number of people have patched this already.
